50 namespace Teuchos {
103  template<class Ordinal, class ScalarType, class IndexType>
104  class MaxLoc :
105  public ValueTypeReductionOp<Ordinal, std::pair<ScalarType, IndexType> > {
106  public:
107  void
108  reduce (const Ordinal count,
109  const std::pair<ScalarType, IndexType> inBuffer[],
110  std::pair<ScalarType, IndexType> inoutBuffer[]) const;
111  };
112 
113  template<class Ordinal>
114  class MaxLoc<Ordinal, double, int> :
115  public ValueTypeReductionOp<Ordinal, std::pair<double, int> > {
116  public:
117  void
118  reduce (const Ordinal count,
119  const std::pair<double, int> inBuffer[],
120  std::pair<double, int> inoutBuffer[]) const
121  {
122  for (Ordinal ind = 0; ind < count; ++ind) {
123  const std::pair<double, int>& in = inBuffer[ind];
124  std::pair<double, int>& inout = inoutBuffer[ind];
125 
126  if (in.first > inout.first) {
127  inout.first = in.first;
128  inout.second = in.second;
129  } else if (in.first < inout.first) {
130  // Don't need to do anything; inout has the values.
131  } else { // equal, or at least one is NaN.
132  inout.first = in.first;
133  inout.second = std::min (in.second, inout.second);
134  }
135  }
136  }
137  };
138 
165  template<class Ordinal, class ScalarType, class IndexType>
166  class MinLoc :
167  public ValueTypeReductionOp<Ordinal, std::pair<ScalarType, IndexType> > {
168  public:
169  void
170  reduce (const Ordinal count,
171  const std::pair<ScalarType, IndexType> inBuffer[],
172  std::pair<ScalarType, IndexType> inoutBuffer[]) const;
173  };
174 
175  template<class Ordinal>
176  class MinLoc<Ordinal, double, int> :
177  public ValueTypeReductionOp<Ordinal, std::pair<double, int> > {
178  public:
179  void
180  reduce (const Ordinal count,
181  const std::pair<double, int> inBuffer[],
182  std::pair<double, int> inoutBuffer[]) const
183  {
184  for (Ordinal ind = 0; ind < count; ++ind) {
185  const std::pair<double, int>& in = inBuffer[ind];
186  std::pair<double, int>& inout = inoutBuffer[ind];
187 
188  if (in.first < inout.first) {
189  inout.first = in.first;
190  inout.second = in.second;
191  } else if (in.first > inout.first) {
192  // Don't need to do anything; inout has the values.
193  } else { // equal, or at least one is NaN.
194  inout.first = in.first;
195  inout.second = std::min (in.second, inout.second);
196  }
197  }
198  }
199  };

201  // Typedef used internally by TimeMonitor::summarize() and its
202  // helper functions. The map is keyed on timer label (a string).
203  // Each value is a pair: (total number of seconds over all calls to
204  // that timer, total number of calls to that timer).
205  typedef std::map<std::string, std::pair<double, int> > timer_map_t;
206 
207  TimeMonitor::TimeMonitor (Time& timer, bool reset)
208  : PerformanceMonitorBase<Time>(timer, reset)
209  {
210  if (!isRecursiveCall()) counter().start(reset);
211  }
212 
213  TimeMonitor::~TimeMonitor() {
214  if (!isRecursiveCall()) counter().stop();
215  }
216 
217  void
218  TimeMonitor::zeroOutTimers()
219  {
220  const Array<RCP<Time> > timers = counters();
221 
222  // In debug mode, loop first to check whether any of the timers
223  // are running, before resetting them. This ensures that this
224  // method satisfies the strong exception guarantee (either it
225  // completes normally, or there are no side effects).
226 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
227  typedef Array<RCP<Time> >::size_type size_type;
228  const size_type numTimers = timers.size();
229  for (size_type i = 0; i < numTimers; ++i) {
230  Time &timer = *timers[i];
231  // We throw a runtime_error rather than a logic_error, because
232  // logic_error suggests a bug in the implementation of
233  // TimeMonitor. Calling zeroOutTimers() when a timer is
234  // running is not TimeMonitor's fault.
235  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(timer.isRunning(), std::runtime_error,
236  "The timer i = " << i << " with name \""
237  << timer.name() << "\" is currently running and may not "
238  "be reset.");
239  }
240 #endif // TEUCHOS_DEBUG
241 
242  for (Array<RCP<Time> >::const_iterator it = timers.begin();
243  it != timers.end(); ++it) {
244  (*it)->reset ();
245  }
246  }
247 
248  // An anonymous namespace is the standard way of limiting linkage of
249  // its contained routines to file scope.
250  namespace {
251  // \brief Return an "empty" local timer datum.
252  //
253  // "Empty" means the datum has zero elapsed time and zero call
254  // count. This function does not actually create a timer.
255  //
256  // \param name The timer's name.
257  std::pair<std::string, std::pair<double, int> >
258  makeEmptyTimerDatum (const std::string& name)
259  {
260  return std::make_pair (name, std::make_pair (double(0), int(0)));
261  }
262 
263  // \fn collectLocalTimerData
264  // \brief Collect and sort local timer data by timer names.
265  //
266  // \param localData [out] Map whose keys are the timer names, and
267  // whose value for each key is the total elapsed time (in
268  // seconds) and the call count for the timer with that name.
269  //
270  // \param localCounters [in] Timers from which to extract data.
271  //
272  // \param filter [in] Filter for timer labels. If filter is not
273  // empty, this method will only collect data for local timers
274  // whose labels begin with this string.
275  //
276  // Extract the total elapsed time and call count from each timer
277  // in the given array. Merge results for timers with duplicate
278  // labels, by summing their total elapsed times and call counts
279  // pairwise.
280  void
281  collectLocalTimerData (timer_map_t& localData,
282  ArrayView<const RCP<Time> > localCounters,
283  const std::string& filter="")
284  {
285  using std::make_pair;
286  typedef timer_map_t::const_iterator const_iter_t;
287  typedef timer_map_t::iterator iter_t;
288 
289  timer_map_t theLocalData;
290  for (ArrayView<const RCP<Time> >::const_iterator it = localCounters.begin();
291  it != localCounters.end(); ++it) {
292  const std::string& name = (*it)->name();
293 
294  // Filter current timer name, if provided filter is nonempty.
295  // Filter string must _start_ the timer label, not just be in it.
296  const bool skipThisOne = (filter != "" && name.find (filter) != 0);
297  if (! skipThisOne) {
298  const double timing = (*it)->totalElapsedTime();
299  const int numCalls = (*it)->numCalls();
300 
301  // Merge timers with duplicate labels, by summing their
302  // total elapsed times and call counts.
303  iter_t loc = theLocalData.find (name);
304  if (loc == theLocalData.end()) {
305  // Use loc as an insertion location hint.
306  theLocalData.insert (loc, make_pair (name, make_pair (timing, numCalls)));
307  }
308  else {
309  loc->second.first += timing;
310  loc->second.second += numCalls;
311  }
312  }
313  }
314  // This avoids copying the map, and also makes this method
315  // satisfy the strong exception guarantee.
316  localData.swap (theLocalData);
317  }
318 
319  // \brief Locally filter out timer data with zero call counts.
320  //
321  // \param timerData [in/out]
322  void
323  filterZeroData (timer_map_t& timerData)
324  {
325  timer_map_t newTimerData;
326  for (timer_map_t::const_iterator it = timerData.begin();
327  it != timerData.end(); ++it) {
328  if (it->second.second > 0) {
329  newTimerData[it->first] = it->second;
330  }
331  }
332  timerData.swap (newTimerData);
333  }
334 
356  void
357  collectLocalTimerDataAndNames (timer_map_t& localTimerData,
358  Array<std::string>& localTimerNames,
359  ArrayView<const RCP<Time> > localTimers,
360  const bool writeZeroTimers,
361  const std::string& filter="")
362  {
363  // Collect and sort local timer data by timer names.
364  collectLocalTimerData (localTimerData, localTimers, filter);
365 
366  // Filter out zero data locally first. This ensures that if we
367  // are writing global stats, and if a timer name exists in the
368  // set of global names, then that timer has a nonzero call count
369  // on at least one MPI process.
370  if (! writeZeroTimers) {
371  filterZeroData (localTimerData);
372  }
373 
374  // Extract the set of local timer names. The std::map keeps
375  // them sorted alphabetically.
376  localTimerNames.reserve (localTimerData.size());
377  for (timer_map_t::const_iterator it = localTimerData.begin();
378  it != localTimerData.end(); ++it) {
379  localTimerNames.push_back (it->first);
380  }
381  }
382 
417  void
418  collectGlobalTimerData (timer_map_t& globalTimerData,
419  Array<std::string>& globalTimerNames,
420  timer_map_t& localTimerData,
421  Array<std::string>& localTimerNames,
422  Ptr<const Comm<int> > comm,
423  const bool alwaysWriteLocal,
424  const ECounterSetOp setOp)
425  {
426  // There may be some global timers that are not local timers on
427  // the calling MPI process(es). In that case, if
428  // alwaysWriteLocal is true, then we need to fill in the
429  // "missing" local timers. That will ensure that both global
430  // and local timer columns in the output table have the same
431  // number of rows. The collectLocalTimerDataAndNames() method
432  // may have already filtered out local timers with zero call
433  // counts (if its writeZeroTimers argument was false), but we
434  // won't be filtering again. Thus, any local timer data we
435  // insert here won't get filtered out.
436  //
437  // Note that calling summarize() with writeZeroTimers == false
438  // will still do what it says, even if we insert local timers
439  // with zero call counts here.
440 
441  // This does the correct and inexpensive thing (just copies the
442  // timer data) if numProcs == 1. Otherwise, it initiates a
443  // communication with \f$O(\log P)\f$ messages along the
444  // critical path, where \f$P\f$ is the number of participating
445  // processes.
446  mergeCounterNames (*comm, localTimerNames, globalTimerNames, setOp);
447 
448 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
449  {
450  // Sanity check that all processes have the name number of
451  // global timer names.
452  const timer_map_t::size_type myNumGlobalNames = globalTimerNames.size();
453  timer_map_t::size_type minNumGlobalNames = 0;
454  timer_map_t::size_type maxNumGlobalNames = 0;
455  reduceAll (*comm, REDUCE_MIN, myNumGlobalNames,
456  outArg (minNumGlobalNames));
457  reduceAll (*comm, REDUCE_MAX, myNumGlobalNames,
458  outArg (maxNumGlobalNames));
459  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(minNumGlobalNames != maxNumGlobalNames,
460  std::logic_error, "Min # global timer names = " << minNumGlobalNames
461  << " != max # global timer names = " << maxNumGlobalNames
462  << ". Please report this bug to the Teuchos developers.");
463  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(myNumGlobalNames != minNumGlobalNames,
464  std::logic_error, "My # global timer names = " << myNumGlobalNames
465  << " != min # global timer names = " << minNumGlobalNames
466  << ". Please report this bug to the Teuchos developers.");
467  }
468 #endif // TEUCHOS_DEBUG
469 
470  // mergeCounterNames() just merges the counters' names, not
471  // their actual data. Now we need to fill globalTimerData with
472  // this process' timer data for the timers in globalTimerNames.
473  //
474  // All processes need the full list of global timers, since
475  // there may be some global timers that are not local timers.
476  // That's why mergeCounterNames() has to be an all-reduce, not
477  // just a reduction to Proc 0.
478  //
479  // Insertion optimization: if the iterator given to map::insert
480  // points right before where we want to insert, insertion is
481  // O(1). globalTimerNames is sorted, so feeding the iterator
482  // output of map::insert into the next invocation's input should
483  // make the whole insertion O(N) where N is the number of
484  // entries in globalTimerNames.
485  timer_map_t::iterator globalMapIter = globalTimerData.begin();
486  timer_map_t::iterator localMapIter;
487  for (Array<string>::const_iterator it = globalTimerNames.begin();
488  it != globalTimerNames.end(); ++it) {
489  const std::string& globalName = *it;
490  localMapIter = localTimerData.find (globalName);
491 
492  if (localMapIter == localTimerData.end()) {
493  if (alwaysWriteLocal) {
494  // If there are some global timers that are not local
495  // timers, and if we want to print local timers, we insert
496  // a local timer datum with zero elapsed time and zero
497  // call count into localTimerData as well. This will
498  // ensure that both global and local timer columns in the
499  // output table have the same number of rows.
500  //
501  // We really only need to do this on Proc 0, which is the
502  // only process that currently may print local timers.
503  // However, we do it on all processes, just in case
504  // someone later wants to modify this function to print
505  // out local timer data for some process other than Proc
506  // 0. This extra computation won't affect the cost along
507  // the critical path, for future computations in which
508  // Proc 0 participates.
509  localMapIter = localTimerData.insert (localMapIter, makeEmptyTimerDatum (globalName));
510 
511  // Make sure the missing global name gets added to the
512  // list of local names. We'll re-sort the list of local
513  // names below.
514  localTimerNames.push_back (globalName);
515  }
516  // There's a global timer that's not a local timer. Add it
517  // to our pre-merge version of the global timer data so that
518  // we can safely merge the global timer data later.
519  globalMapIter = globalTimerData.insert (globalMapIter, makeEmptyTimerDatum (globalName));
520  }
521  else {
522  // We have this global timer name in our local timer list.
523  // Fill in our pre-merge version of the global timer data
524  // with our local data.
525  globalMapIter = globalTimerData.insert (globalMapIter, std::make_pair (globalName, localMapIter->second));
526  }
527  }
528 
529  if (alwaysWriteLocal) {
530  // Re-sort the list of local timer names, since we may have
531  // inserted "missing" names above.
532  std::sort (localTimerNames.begin(), localTimerNames.end());
533  }
534 
535 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
536  {
537  // Sanity check that all processes have the name number of
538  // global timers.
539  const timer_map_t::size_type myNumGlobalTimers = globalTimerData.size();
540  timer_map_t::size_type minNumGlobalTimers = 0;
541  timer_map_t::size_type maxNumGlobalTimers = 0;
542  reduceAll (*comm, REDUCE_MIN, myNumGlobalTimers,
543  outArg (minNumGlobalTimers));
544  reduceAll (*comm, REDUCE_MAX, myNumGlobalTimers,
545  outArg (maxNumGlobalTimers));
546  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(minNumGlobalTimers != maxNumGlobalTimers,
547  std::logic_error, "Min # global timers = " << minNumGlobalTimers
548  << " != max # global timers = " << maxNumGlobalTimers
549  << ". Please report this bug to the Teuchos developers.");
550  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(myNumGlobalTimers != minNumGlobalTimers,
551  std::logic_error, "My # global timers = " << myNumGlobalTimers
552  << " != min # global timers = " << minNumGlobalTimers
553  << ". Please report this bug to the Teuchos developers.");
554  }
555 #endif // TEUCHOS_DEBUG
556  }
557 
595  void
596  computeGlobalTimerStats (stat_map_type& statData,
597  std::vector<std::string>& statNames,
598  Ptr<const Comm<int> > comm,
599  const timer_map_t& globalTimerData)
600  {
601  const int numTimers = static_cast<int> (globalTimerData.size());
602  const int numProcs = comm->getSize();
603 
604  // Extract pre-reduction timings and call counts into a
605  // sequential array. This array will be in the same order as
606  // the global timer names are in the map.
607  Array<std::pair<double, int> > timingsAndCallCounts;
608  timingsAndCallCounts.reserve (numTimers);
609  for (timer_map_t::const_iterator it = globalTimerData.begin();
610  it != globalTimerData.end(); ++it) {
611  timingsAndCallCounts.push_back (it->second);
612  }
613 
614  // For each timer name, compute the min timing and its
615  // corresponding call count. If two processes have the same
616  // timing but different call counts, the minimum call count will
617  // be used.
618  Array<std::pair<double, int> > minTimingsAndCallCounts (numTimers);
619  if (numTimers > 0) {
620  reduceAll (*comm, MinLoc<int, double, int>(), numTimers,
621  &timingsAndCallCounts[0], &minTimingsAndCallCounts[0]);
622  }
623 
624  // For each timer name, compute the max timing and its
625  // corresponding call count. If two processes have the same
626  // timing but different call counts, the minimum call count will
627  // be used.
628  Array<std::pair<double, int> > maxTimingsAndCallCounts (numTimers);
629  if (numTimers > 0) {
630  reduceAll (*comm, MaxLoc<int, double, int>(), numTimers,
631  &timingsAndCallCounts[0], &maxTimingsAndCallCounts[0]);
632  }
633 
634  // For each timer name, compute the mean-over-processes timing,
635  // the mean call count, and the mean-over-call-counts timing.
636  // The mean call count is reported as a double to allow a
637  // fractional value.
638  //
639  // Each local timing is really the total timing over all local
640  // invocations. The number of local invocations is the call
641  // count. Thus, the mean-over-call-counts timing is the sum of
642  // all the timings (over all processes), divided by the sum of
643  // all the call counts (over all processes). We compute it in a
644  // different way to over unnecessary overflow.
645  Array<double> meanOverCallCountsTimings (numTimers);
646  Array<double> meanOverProcsTimings (numTimers);
647  Array<double> meanCallCounts (numTimers);
648  {
649  // When summing, first scale by the number of processes. This
650  // avoids unnecessary overflow, and also gives us the mean
651  // call count automatically.
652  Array<double> scaledTimings (numTimers);
653  Array<double> scaledCallCounts (numTimers);
654  const double P = static_cast<double> (numProcs);
655  for (int k = 0; k < numTimers; ++k) {
656  const double timing = timingsAndCallCounts[k].first;
657  const double callCount = static_cast<double> (timingsAndCallCounts[k].second);
658 
659  scaledTimings[k] = timing / P;
660  scaledCallCounts[k] = callCount / P;
661  }
662  if (numTimers > 0) {
663  reduceAll (*comm, REDUCE_SUM, numTimers, &scaledTimings[0],
664  &meanOverProcsTimings[0]);
665  reduceAll (*comm, REDUCE_SUM, numTimers, &scaledCallCounts[0],
666  &meanCallCounts[0]);
667  }
668  // We don't have to undo the scaling for the mean timings;
669  // just divide by the scaled call count.
670  for (int k = 0; k < numTimers; ++k) {
671  meanOverCallCountsTimings[k] = meanOverProcsTimings[k] / meanCallCounts[k];
672  }
673  }
674 
675  // Reformat the data into the map of statistics. Be sure that
676  // each value (the std::vector of (timing, call count) pairs,
677  // each entry of which is a different statistic) preserves the
678  // order of statNames.
679  statNames.resize (4);
680  statNames[0] = "MinOverProcs";
681  statNames[1] = "MeanOverProcs";
682  statNames[2] = "MaxOverProcs";
683  statNames[3] = "MeanOverCallCounts";
684 
685  stat_map_type::iterator statIter = statData.end();
686  timer_map_t::const_iterator it = globalTimerData.begin();
687  for (int k = 0; it != globalTimerData.end(); ++k, ++it) {
688  std::vector<std::pair<double, double> > curData (4);
689  curData[0] = minTimingsAndCallCounts[k];
690  curData[1] = std::make_pair (meanOverProcsTimings[k], meanCallCounts[k]);
691  curData[2] = maxTimingsAndCallCounts[k];
692  curData[3] = std::make_pair (meanOverCallCountsTimings[k], meanCallCounts[k]);
693 
694  // statIter gives an insertion location hint that makes each
695  // insertion O(1), since we remember the location of the last
696  // insertion.
697  statIter = statData.insert (statIter, std::make_pair (it->first, curData));
698  }
699  }
700 
701 
718  RCP<const Comm<int> >
719  getDefaultComm ()
720  {
721  // The default communicator. If Trilinos was built with MPI
722  // enabled, this should be MPI_COMM_WORLD. (If MPI has not yet
723  // been initialized, it's not valid to use the communicator!)
724  // Otherwise, this should be a "serial" (no MPI, one "process")
725  // communicator.
726  RCP<const Comm<int> > comm = DefaultComm<int>::getComm ();
727 
728 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
729  {
730  int mpiHasBeenStarted = 0;
731  MPI_Initialized (&mpiHasBeenStarted);
732  if (! mpiHasBeenStarted) {
733  // Make pComm a new "serial communicator."
734  comm = rcp_implicit_cast<const Comm<int> > (rcp (new SerialComm<int> ()));
735  }
736  }
737 #endif // HAVE_MPI
738  return comm;
739  }
740 
741  } // namespace (anonymous)
742 
743 
744  void
745  TimeMonitor::computeGlobalTimerStatistics (stat_map_type& statData,
746  std::vector<std::string>& statNames,
747  Ptr<const Comm<int> > comm,
748  const ECounterSetOp setOp,
749  const std::string& filter)
750  {
751  // Collect local timer data and names. Filter out timers with
752  // zero call counts if writeZeroTimers is false. Also, apply the
753  // timer label filter at this point, so we don't have to compute
754  // statistics on timers we don't want to display anyway.
755  timer_map_t localTimerData;
756  Array<std::string> localTimerNames;
757  const bool writeZeroTimers = false;
758  collectLocalTimerDataAndNames (localTimerData, localTimerNames,
759  counters(), writeZeroTimers, filter);
760  // Merge the local timer data and names into global timer data and
761  // names.
762  timer_map_t globalTimerData;
763  Array<std::string> globalTimerNames;
764  const bool alwaysWriteLocal = false;
765  collectGlobalTimerData (globalTimerData, globalTimerNames,
766  localTimerData, localTimerNames,
767  comm, alwaysWriteLocal, setOp);
768  // Compute statistics on the data.
769  computeGlobalTimerStats (statData, statNames, comm, globalTimerData);
770  }
771 
772 
773  void
774  TimeMonitor::summarize (Ptr<const Comm<int> > comm,
775  std::ostream& out,
776  const bool alwaysWriteLocal,
777  const bool writeGlobalStats,
778  const bool writeZeroTimers,
779  const ECounterSetOp setOp,
780  const std::string& filter)
781  {
782  //
783  // We can't just call computeGlobalTimerStatistics(), since
784  // summarize() has different options that affect whether global
785  // statistics are computed and printed.
786  //
787  const int numProcs = comm->getSize();
788  const int myRank = comm->getRank();
789 
790  // Collect local timer data and names. Filter out timers with
791  // zero call counts if writeZeroTimers is false. Also, apply the
792  // timer label filter at this point, so we don't have to compute
793  // statistics on timers we don't want to display anyway.
794  timer_map_t localTimerData;
795  Array<std::string> localTimerNames;
796  collectLocalTimerDataAndNames (localTimerData, localTimerNames,
797  counters(), writeZeroTimers, filter);
798 
799  // If we're computing global statistics, merge the local timer
800  // data and names into global timer data and names, and compute
801  // global timer statistics. Otherwise, leave the global data
802  // empty.
803  timer_map_t globalTimerData;
804  Array<std::string> globalTimerNames;
805  stat_map_type statData;
806  std::vector<std::string> statNames;
807  if (writeGlobalStats) {
808  collectGlobalTimerData (globalTimerData, globalTimerNames,
809  localTimerData, localTimerNames,
810  comm, alwaysWriteLocal, setOp);
811  // Compute statistics on the data, but only if the communicator
812  // contains more than one process. Otherwise, statistics don't
813  // make sense and we don't print them (see below).
814  if (numProcs > 1) {
815  computeGlobalTimerStats (statData, statNames, comm, globalTimerData);
816  }
817  }
818 
819  // Precision of floating-point numbers in the table.
820  const int precision = format().precision();
821 
822  // All columns of the table, in order.
823  Array<TableColumn> tableColumns;
824 
825  // Labels of all the columns of the table.
826  // We will append to this when we add each column.
827  Array<std::string> titles;
828 
829  // Widths (in number of characters) of each column.
830  // We will append to this when we add each column.
831  Array<int> columnWidths;
832 
833  // Table column containing all timer names. If writeGlobalStats
834  // is true, we use the global timer names, otherwise we use the
835  // local timer names. We build the table on all processes
836  // redundantly, but only print on Rank 0.
837  {
838  titles.append ("Timer Name");
839 
840  // The column labels depend on whether we are computing global statistics.
841  TableColumn nameCol (writeGlobalStats ? globalTimerNames : localTimerNames);
842  tableColumns.append (nameCol);
843 
844  // Each column is as wide as it needs to be to hold both its
845  // title and all of the column data. This column's title is the
846  // current last entry of the titles array.
847  columnWidths.append (format().computeRequiredColumnWidth (titles.back(), nameCol));
848  }
849 
850  // Table column containing local timer stats, if applicable. We
851  // only write local stats if asked, only on MPI Proc 0, and only
852  // if there is more than one MPI process in the communicator
853  // (otherwise local stats == global stats, so we just print the
854  // global stats). In this case, we've padded the local data on
855  // Proc 0 if necessary to match the global timer list, so that the
856  // columns have the same number of rows.
857  if (alwaysWriteLocal && numProcs > 1 && myRank == 0) {
858  titles.append ("Local time (num calls)");
859 
860  // Copy local timer data out of the array-of-structs into
861  // separate arrays, for display in the table.
862  Array<double> localTimings;
863  Array<double> localNumCalls;
864  for (timer_map_t::const_iterator it = localTimerData.begin();
865  it != localTimerData.end(); ++it) {
866  localTimings.push_back (it->second.first);
867  localNumCalls.push_back (static_cast<double> (it->second.second));
868  }
869  TableColumn timeAndCalls (localTimings, localNumCalls, precision, true);
870  tableColumns.append (timeAndCalls);
871  columnWidths.append (format().computeRequiredColumnWidth (titles.back(), timeAndCalls));
872  }
873 
874  if (writeGlobalStats) {
875  // If there's only 1 process in the communicator, don't display
876  // statistics; statistics don't make sense in that case. Just
877  // display the timings and call counts. If there's more than 1
878  // process, do display statistics.
879  if (numProcs == 1) {
880  // Extract timings and the call counts from globalTimerData.
881  Array<double> globalTimings;
882  Array<double> globalNumCalls;
883  for (timer_map_t::const_iterator it = globalTimerData.begin();
884  it != globalTimerData.end(); ++it) {
885  globalTimings.push_back (it->second.first);
886  globalNumCalls.push_back (static_cast<double> (it->second.second));
887  }
888  // Print the table column.
889  titles.append ("Global time (num calls)");
890  TableColumn timeAndCalls (globalTimings, globalNumCalls, precision, true);
891  tableColumns.append (timeAndCalls);
892  columnWidths.append (format().computeRequiredColumnWidth (titles.back(), timeAndCalls));
893  }
894  else { // numProcs > 1
895  // Print a table column for each statistic. statNames and
896  // each value in statData use the same ordering, so we can
897  // iterate over valid indices of statNames to display the
898  // statistics in the right order.
899  const timer_map_t::size_type numGlobalTimers = globalTimerData.size();
900  for (std::vector<std::string>::size_type statInd = 0; statInd < statNames.size(); ++statInd) {
901  // Extract lists of timings and their call counts for the
902  // current statistic.
903  Array<double> statTimings (numGlobalTimers);
904  Array<double> statCallCounts (numGlobalTimers);
905  stat_map_type::const_iterator it = statData.begin();
906  for (int k = 0; it != statData.end(); ++it, ++k) {
907  statTimings[k] = (it->second[statInd]).first;
908  statCallCounts[k] = (it->second[statInd]).second;
909  }
910  // Print the table column.
911  const std::string& statisticName = statNames[statInd];
912  const std::string titleString = statisticName;
913  titles.append (titleString);
914  TableColumn timeAndCalls (statTimings, statCallCounts, precision, true);
915  tableColumns.append (timeAndCalls);
916  columnWidths.append (format().computeRequiredColumnWidth (titles.back(), timeAndCalls));
917  }
918  }
919  }
920 
921  // Print the whole table to the given output stream on MPI Rank 0.
922  format().setColumnWidths (columnWidths);
923  if (myRank == 0) {
924  std::ostringstream theTitle;
925  theTitle << "TimeMonitor results over " << numProcs << " processor"
926  << (numProcs > 1 ? "s" : "");
927  format().writeWholeTable (out, theTitle.str(), titles, tableColumns);
928  }
929  }
930 
931  void
932  TimeMonitor::summarize (std::ostream &out,
933  const bool alwaysWriteLocal,
934  const bool writeGlobalStats,
935  const bool writeZeroTimers,
936  const ECounterSetOp setOp,
937  const std::string& filter)
938  {
939  // The default communicator. If Trilinos was built with MPI
940  // enabled, this should be MPI_COMM_WORLD. Otherwise, this should
941  // be a "serial" (no MPI, one "process") communicator.
942  RCP<const Comm<int> > comm = getDefaultComm();
943 
944  summarize (comm.ptr(), out, alwaysWriteLocal,
945  writeGlobalStats, writeZeroTimers, setOp, filter);
946  }
947 
948  void
949  TimeMonitor::computeGlobalTimerStatistics (stat_map_type& statData,
950  std::vector<std::string>& statNames,
951  const ECounterSetOp setOp,
952  const std::string& filter)
953  {
954  // The default communicator. If Trilinos was built with MPI
955  // enabled, this should be MPI_COMM_WORLD. Otherwise, this should
956  // be a "serial" (no MPI, one "process") communicator.
957  RCP<const Comm<int> > comm = getDefaultComm();
958 
959  computeGlobalTimerStatistics (statData, statNames, comm.ptr(), setOp, filter);
960  }
961 
962 
963  namespace {
987  std::string
988  quoteLabelForYaml (const std::string& label)
989  {
990  // YAML allows empty keys in key: value pairs. See Section 7.2
991  // of the YAML 1.2 spec. We thus let an empty label pass
992  // through without quoting or other special treatment.
993  if (label.empty ()) {
994  return label;
995  }
996 
997  // Check whether the label is already quoted. If so, we don't
998  // need to quote it again. However, we do need to quote any
999  // quote symbols in the string inside the outer quotes.
1000  const bool alreadyQuoted = label.size () >= 2 &&
1001  label[0] == '"' && label[label.size() - 1] == '"';
1002 
1003  // We need to quote if there are any colons or (inner) quotes in
1004  // the string. We'll determine this as we read through the
1005  // string and escape any characters that need escaping.
1006  bool needToQuote = false;
1007 
1008  std::string out; // To fill with the return value
1009  out.reserve (label.size ());
1010 
1011  const size_t startPos = alreadyQuoted ? 1 : 0;
1012  const size_t endPos = alreadyQuoted ? label.size () - 1 : label.size ();
1013  for (size_t i = startPos; i < endPos; ++i) {
1014  const char c = label[i];
1015  if (c == '"' || c == '\\') {
1016  out.push_back ('\\'); // Escape the quote or backslash.
1017  needToQuote = true;
1018  }
1019  else if (c == ':') {
1020  needToQuote = true;
1021  }
1022  out.push_back (c);
1023  }
1024 
1025  if (needToQuote || alreadyQuoted) {
1026  // If the input string was already quoted, then out doesn't
1027  // include its quotes, so we have to add them back in.
1028  return "\"" + out + "\"";
1029  }
1030  else {
1031  return out;
1032  }
1033  }
1034 
1035  } // namespace (anonymous)
1036 
1037 
1038  void TimeMonitor::
1039  summarizeToYaml (Ptr<const Comm<int> > comm,
1040  std::ostream &out,
1041  const ETimeMonitorYamlFormat yamlStyle,
1042  const std::string& filter)
1043  {
1044  using Teuchos::FancyOStream;
1045  using Teuchos::fancyOStream;
1046  using Teuchos::getFancyOStream;
1047  using Teuchos::OSTab;
1048  using Teuchos::RCP;
1049  using Teuchos::rcpFromRef;
1050  using std::endl;
1051  typedef std::vector<std::string>::size_type size_type;
1052 
1053  const bool compact = (yamlStyle == YAML_FORMAT_COMPACT);
1054 
1055  // const bool writeGlobalStats = true;
1056  // const bool writeZeroTimers = true;
1057  // const bool alwaysWriteLocal = false;
1058  const ECounterSetOp setOp = Intersection;
1059 
1060  stat_map_type statData;
1061  std::vector<std::string> statNames;
1062  computeGlobalTimerStatistics (statData, statNames, comm, setOp, filter);
1063 
1064  const int numProcs = comm->getSize();
1065 
1066  // HACK (mfh 20 Aug 2012) For some reason, creating OSTab with "-
1067  // " as the line prefix does not work, else I would prefer that
1068  // method for printing each line of a YAML block sequence (see
1069  // Section 8.2.1 of the YAML 1.2 spec).
1070  //
1071  // Also, I have to set the tab indent string here, rather than in
1072  // OSTab's constructor. This is because line prefix (which for
1073  // some reason is what OSTab's constructor takes, rather than tab
1074  // indent string) means something different from tab indent
1075  // string, and turning on the line prefix prints all sorts of
1076  // things including "|" for some reason.
1077  RCP<FancyOStream> pfout = getFancyOStream (rcpFromRef (out));
1078  pfout->setTabIndentStr (" ");
1079  FancyOStream& fout = *pfout;
1080 
1081  fout << "# Teuchos::TimeMonitor report" << endl
1082  << "---" << endl;
1083 
1084  // mfh 19 Aug 2012: An important goal of our chosen output format
1085  // was to minimize the nesting depth. We have managed to keep the
1086  // nesting depth to 3, which is the limit that the current version
1087  // of PylotDB imposes for its YAML input.
1088 
1089  // Outermost level is a dictionary. (Individual entries of a
1090  // dictionary do _not_ begin with "- ".) We always print the
1091  // outermost level in standard style, not flow style, for better
1092  // readability. We begin the outermost level with metadata.
1093  fout << "Output mode: " << (compact ? "compact" : "spacious") << endl
1094  << "Number of processes: " << numProcs << endl
1095  << "Time unit: s" << endl;
1096  // For a key: value pair where the value is a sequence or
1097  // dictionary on the following line, YAML requires a space after
1098  // the colon.
1099  fout << "Statistics collected: ";
1100  // Print list of the names of all the statistics we collected.
1101  if (compact) {
1102  fout << " [";
1103  for (size_type i = 0; i < statNames.size (); ++i) {
1104  fout << quoteLabelForYaml (statNames[i]);
1105  if (i + 1 < statNames.size ()) {
1106  fout << ", ";
1107  }
1108  }
1109  fout << "]" << endl;
1110  }
1111  else {
1112  fout << endl;
1113  OSTab tab1 (pfout);
1114  for (size_type i = 0; i < statNames.size (); ++i) {
1115  fout << "- " << quoteLabelForYaml (statNames[i]) << endl;
1116  }
1117  }
1118 
1119  // Print the list of timer names.
1120  //
1121  // It might be nicer instead to print a map from timer name to all
1122  // of its data, but keeping the maximum nesting depth small
1123  // ensures better compatibility with different parsing tools.
1124  fout << "Timer names: ";
1125  if (compact) {
1126  fout << " [";
1127  size_type ind = 0;
1128  for (stat_map_type::const_iterator it = statData.begin();
1129  it != statData.end(); ++it, ++ind) {
1130  fout << quoteLabelForYaml (it->first);
1131  if (ind + 1 < statData.size ()) {
1132  fout << ", ";
1133  }
1134  }
1135  fout << "]" << endl;
1136  }
1137  else {
1138  fout << endl;
1139  OSTab tab1 (pfout);
1140  for (stat_map_type::const_iterator it = statData.begin();
1141  it != statData.end(); ++it) {
1142  fout << "- " << quoteLabelForYaml (it->first) << endl;
1143  }
1144  }
1145 
1146  // Print times for each timer, as a map from statistic name to its time.
1147  fout << "Total times: ";
1148  if (compact) {
1149  fout << " {";
1150  size_type outerInd = 0;
1151  for (stat_map_type::const_iterator outerIter = statData.begin();
1152  outerIter != statData.end(); ++outerIter, ++outerInd) {
1153  // Print timer name.
1154  fout << quoteLabelForYaml (outerIter->first) << ": ";
1155  // Print that timer's data.
1156  const std::vector<std::pair<double, double> >& curData = outerIter->second;
1157  fout << "{";
1158  for (size_type innerInd = 0; innerInd < curData.size (); ++innerInd) {
1159  fout << quoteLabelForYaml (statNames[innerInd]) << ": "
1160  << curData[innerInd].first;
1161  if (innerInd + 1 < curData.size ()) {
1162  fout << ", ";
1163  }
1164  }
1165  fout << "}";
1166  if (outerInd + 1 < statData.size ()) {
1167  fout << ", ";
1168  }
1169  }
1170  fout << "}" << endl;
1171  }
1172  else {
1173  fout << endl;
1174  OSTab tab1 (pfout);
1175  size_type outerInd = 0;
1176  for (stat_map_type::const_iterator outerIter = statData.begin();
1177  outerIter != statData.end(); ++outerIter, ++outerInd) {
1178  // Print timer name.
1179  fout << quoteLabelForYaml (outerIter->first) << ": " << endl;
1180  // Print that timer's data.
1181  OSTab tab2 (pfout);
1182  const std::vector<std::pair<double, double> >& curData = outerIter->second;
1183  for (size_type innerInd = 0; innerInd < curData.size (); ++innerInd) {
1184  fout << quoteLabelForYaml (statNames[innerInd]) << ": "
1185  << curData[innerInd].first << endl;
1186  }
1187  }
1188  }
1189 
1190  // Print call counts for each timer, for each statistic name.
1191  fout << "Call counts:";
1192  if (compact) {
1193  fout << " {";
1194  size_type outerInd = 0;
1195  for (stat_map_type::const_iterator outerIter = statData.begin();
1196  outerIter != statData.end(); ++outerIter, ++outerInd) {
1197  // Print timer name.
1198  fout << quoteLabelForYaml (outerIter->first) << ": ";
1199  // Print that timer's data.
1200  const std::vector<std::pair<double, double> >& curData = outerIter->second;
1201  fout << "{";
1202  for (size_type innerInd = 0; innerInd < curData.size (); ++innerInd) {
1203  fout << quoteLabelForYaml (statNames[innerInd]) << ": "
1204  << curData[innerInd].second;
1205  if (innerInd + 1 < curData.size ()) {
1206  fout << ", ";
1207  }
1208  }
1209  fout << "}";
1210  if (outerInd + 1 < statData.size ()) {
1211  fout << ", ";
1212  }
1213  }
1214  fout << "}" << endl;
1215  }
1216  else {
1217  fout << endl;
1218  OSTab tab1 (pfout);
1219  size_type outerInd = 0;
1220  for (stat_map_type::const_iterator outerIter = statData.begin();
1221  outerIter != statData.end(); ++outerIter, ++outerInd) {
1222  // Print timer name.
1223  fout << quoteLabelForYaml (outerIter->first) << ": " << endl;
1224  // Print that timer's data.
1225  OSTab tab2 (pfout);
1226  const std::vector<std::pair<double, double> >& curData = outerIter->second;
1227  for (size_type innerInd = 0; innerInd < curData.size (); ++innerInd) {
1228  fout << quoteLabelForYaml (statNames[innerInd]) << ": "
1229  << curData[innerInd].second << endl;
1230  }
1231  }
1232  }
1233  }
1234 
1235  void TimeMonitor::
1236  summarizeToYaml (std::ostream &out,
1237  const ETimeMonitorYamlFormat yamlStyle,
1238  const std::string& filter)
1239  {
1240  // The default communicator. If Trilinos was built with MPI
1241  // enabled, this should be MPI_COMM_WORLD. Otherwise, this should
1242  // be a "serial" (no MPI, one "process") communicator.
1243  RCP<const Comm<int> > comm = getDefaultComm ();
1244 
1245  summarizeToYaml (comm.ptr (), out, yamlStyle, filter);
1246  }
1247 
1248  // Default value is false. We'll set to true once
1249  // setReportParameters() completes successfully.
1250  bool TimeMonitor::setParams_ = false;
1251 
1252  // We have to declare all of these here in order to avoid linker errors.
1253  TimeMonitor::ETimeMonitorReportFormat TimeMonitor::reportFormat_ = TimeMonitor::REPORT_FORMAT_TABLE;
1254  TimeMonitor::ETimeMonitorYamlFormat TimeMonitor::yamlStyle_ = TimeMonitor::YAML_FORMAT_SPACIOUS;
1255  ECounterSetOp TimeMonitor::setOp_ = Intersection;
1256  bool TimeMonitor::alwaysWriteLocal_ = false;
1257  bool TimeMonitor::writeGlobalStats_ = true;
1258  bool TimeMonitor::writeZeroTimers_ = true;
1259 
1260  void
1261  TimeMonitor::setReportFormatParameter (ParameterList& plist)
1262  {
1263  const std::string name ("Report format");
1264  const std::string defaultValue ("Table");
1265  const std::string docString ("Output format for report of timer statistics");
1266  Array<std::string> strings;
1267  Array<std::string> docs;
1268  Array<ETimeMonitorReportFormat> values;
1269 
1270  strings.push_back ("YAML");
1271  docs.push_back ("YAML (see yaml.org) format");
1272  values.push_back (REPORT_FORMAT_YAML);
1273  strings.push_back ("Table");
1274  docs.push_back ("Tabular format via Teuchos::TableFormat");
1275  values.push_back (REPORT_FORMAT_TABLE);
1276 
1277  setStringToIntegralParameter<ETimeMonitorReportFormat> (name, defaultValue,
1278  docString,
1279  strings (), docs (),
1280  values (), &plist);
1281  }
1282 
1283  void
1284  TimeMonitor::setYamlFormatParameter (ParameterList& plist)
1285  {
1286  const std::string name ("YAML style");
1287  const std::string defaultValue ("spacious");
1288  const std::string docString ("YAML-specific output format");
1289  Array<std::string> strings;
1290  Array<std::string> docs;
1291  Array<ETimeMonitorYamlFormat> values;
1292 
1293  strings.push_back ("compact");
1294  docs.push_back ("Compact format: use \"flow style\" (see YAML 1.2 spec at "
1295  "yaml.org) for most sequences except the outermost sequence");
1296  values.push_back (YAML_FORMAT_COMPACT);
1297 
1298  strings.push_back ("spacious");
1299  docs.push_back ("Spacious format: avoid flow style");
1300  values.push_back (YAML_FORMAT_SPACIOUS);
1301 
1302  setStringToIntegralParameter<ETimeMonitorYamlFormat> (name, defaultValue,
1303  docString,
1304  strings (), docs (),
1305  values (), &plist);
1306  }
1307 
1308  void
1309  TimeMonitor::setSetOpParameter (ParameterList& plist)
1310  {
1311  const std::string name ("How to merge timer sets");
1312  const std::string defaultValue ("Intersection");
1313  const std::string docString ("How to merge differing sets of timers "
1314  "across processes");
1315  Array<std::string> strings;
1316  Array<std::string> docs;
1317  Array<ECounterSetOp> values;
1318 
1319  strings.push_back ("Intersection");
1320  docs.push_back ("Compute intersection of timer sets over processes");
1321  values.push_back (Intersection);
1322  strings.push_back ("Union");
1323  docs.push_back ("Compute union of timer sets over processes");
1324  values.push_back (Union);
1325 
1326  setStringToIntegralParameter<ECounterSetOp> (name, defaultValue, docString,
1327  strings (), docs (), values (),
1328  &plist);
1329  }
1330 
1331  RCP<const ParameterList>
1332  TimeMonitor::getValidReportParameters ()
1333  {
1334  // Our implementation favors recomputation over persistent
1335  // storage. That is, we simply recreate the list every time we
1336  // need it.
1337  RCP<ParameterList> plist = parameterList ("TimeMonitor::report");
1338 
1339  const bool alwaysWriteLocal = false;
1340  const bool writeGlobalStats = true;
1341  const bool writeZeroTimers = true;
1342 
1343  setReportFormatParameter (*plist);
1344  setYamlFormatParameter (*plist);
1345  setSetOpParameter (*plist);
1346  plist->set ("alwaysWriteLocal", alwaysWriteLocal,
1347  "Always output local timers' values on Proc 0");
1348  plist->set ("writeGlobalStats", writeGlobalStats, "Always output global "
1349  "statistics, even if there is only one process in the "
1350  "communicator");
1351  plist->set ("writeZeroTimers", writeZeroTimers, "Generate output for "
1352  "timers that have never been called");
1353 
1354  return rcp_const_cast<const ParameterList> (plist);
1355  }
1356 
1357  void
1358  TimeMonitor::setReportParameters (const RCP<ParameterList>& params)
1359  {
1360  ETimeMonitorReportFormat reportFormat = REPORT_FORMAT_TABLE;
1361  ETimeMonitorYamlFormat yamlStyle = YAML_FORMAT_SPACIOUS;
1362  ECounterSetOp setOp = Intersection;
1363  bool alwaysWriteLocal = false;
1364  bool writeGlobalStats = true;
1365  bool writeZeroTimers = true;
1366 
1367  if (params.is_null ()) {
1368  // If we've set parameters before, leave their current values.
1369  // Otherwise, set defaults (below).
1370  if (setParams_) {
1371  return;
1372  }
1373  }
1374  else { // params is nonnull. Let's read it!
1375  params->validateParametersAndSetDefaults (*getValidReportParameters ());
1376 
1377  reportFormat = getIntegralValue<ETimeMonitorReportFormat> (*params, "Report format");
1378  yamlStyle = getIntegralValue<ETimeMonitorYamlFormat> (*params, "YAML style");
1379  setOp = getIntegralValue<ECounterSetOp> (*params, "How to merge timer sets");
1380  alwaysWriteLocal = params->get<bool> ("alwaysWriteLocal");
1381  writeGlobalStats = params->get<bool> ("writeGlobalStats");
1382  writeZeroTimers = params->get<bool> ("writeZeroTimers");
1383  }
1384  // Defer setting state until here, to ensure the strong exception
1385  // guarantee for this method (either it throws with no externally
1386  // visible state changes, or it returns normally).
1387  reportFormat_ = reportFormat;
1388  yamlStyle_ = yamlStyle;
1389  setOp_ = setOp;
1390  alwaysWriteLocal_ = alwaysWriteLocal;
1391  writeGlobalStats_ = writeGlobalStats;
1392  writeZeroTimers_ = writeZeroTimers;
1393 
1394  setParams_ = true; // Yay, we successfully set parameters!
1395  }
1396 
1397  void
1398  TimeMonitor::report (Ptr<const Comm<int> > comm,
1399  std::ostream& out,
1400  const std::string& filter,
1401  const RCP<ParameterList>& params)
1402  {
1403  setReportParameters (params);
1404 
1405  if (reportFormat_ == REPORT_FORMAT_YAML) {
1406  summarizeToYaml (comm, out, yamlStyle_, filter);
1407  }
1408  else if (reportFormat_ == REPORT_FORMAT_TABLE) {
1409  summarize (comm, out, alwaysWriteLocal_, writeGlobalStats_,
1410  writeZeroTimers_, setOp_, filter);
1411  }
1412  else {
1413  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(true, std::logic_error, "TimeMonitor::report: "
1414  "Invalid report format. This should never happen; ParameterList "
1415  "validation should have caught this. Please report this bug to the "
1416  "Teuchos developers.");
1417  }
1418  }
1419 
1420  void
1421  TimeMonitor::report (Ptr<const Comm<int> > comm,
1422  std::ostream& out,
1423  const RCP<ParameterList>& params)
1424  {
1425  report (comm, out, "", params);
1426  }
1427 
1428  void
1429  TimeMonitor::report (std::ostream& out,
1430  const std::string& filter,
1431  const RCP<ParameterList>& params)
1432  {
1433  RCP<const Comm<int> > comm = getDefaultComm ();
1434  report (comm.ptr (), out, filter, params);
1435  }
1436 
1437  void
1438  TimeMonitor::report (std::ostream& out,
1439  const RCP<ParameterList>& params)
1440  {
1441  RCP<const Comm<int> > comm = getDefaultComm ();
1442  report (comm.ptr (), out, "", params);
1443  }
